text: Leon Brittan, Baron Brittan of Spennithorne (25 September 1939 – 21 January 2015) was a British politician and barrister. A member of the Conservative Party, he served as Home Secretary (1983-1985), a member of Parliament (MP) and subsequently of the European Commission. Brittan died of cancer in London, aged 75. In October 2014, a Labour MP used parliamentary privilege to refer to claims that Brittan had been linked to child abuse. On 21 March 2016, the Metropolitan Police confirmed that "Operation Midland", the investigation into the alleged paedophile ring, had been closed without any charges being brought. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1939 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:English King's Counsel Category:European Commissioners Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:Members of the British House of Commons for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom Category:Knights Bachelor Category:Jewish British politicians Category:Jewish lawyers Category:Conservative Life Peers Category:Politicians from London Category:Secretaries of State for the Home Department
